description: Saurashtra will play Mumbai for the Ranji Trophy, which the bigger club has won 39 times in 78 competitions.
title: Cricket Upstart Takes on Powerhouse for Indian Title
title_page: Cricket Upstart Takes on Powerhouse for Indian Title - The New York Times
maintext:
It will be a true David vs. Goliath when Saurashtra takes on Mumbai for the Ranji Trophy in India starting this Saturday.
Mumbai has dominated Indian first-class domestic cricket so much — out of 78 competitions, it has won the championship trophy 39 times, exactly half — that it can make other sports powerhouses like the New York Yankees in baseball and Real Madrid in soccer look like bit players. No other team has won the trophy more than seven times.
Saurashtra, from India’s northwestern coast, has not won the trophy since 1937, when it was known as Nawanagar, and has not played in the final since 1938. Mumbai last won in 2010. (Rajasthan, which won the trophy the last two years, did not make it out of the group stage this season.)
To add to the pressure, Mumbai also has home advantage; the match, scheduled for five days, will be played in Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai, site of the 2011 World Cup final.
